Message:
I walk with the man
and his friends,
half-dragging my broken
cannon behind me.

I thought power was justice.
That’s why I underwent
the most rigorous of training.

But now, saving the world
right before my very eyes
is a person who’d be
better off being called weak.

This person’s dispelling
the cursed black flames,
holding his hand out to the people,
and restoring the smiles they lost.

He’s different from
the one I once admired.

But, there’s a familiar
warmth and gentleness...

Ah, what the heck...
How could I have not
realized something so simple?

What’s important isn’t power.
It’s what we fight for that is.

I didn’t even understand
something that was
so completely obvious.
